H0.text: Sexual reproduction is the function for which the flower is an angiosperm structure specialized.

H1.text: Asexual reproduction is the function for which the flower is an angiosperm structure specialized.

H2.text: Nutrient production is the function for which the flower, an angiosperm structure, is specialized.

H3.text: Protection from cold is the function for which the flower is an angiosperm structure specialized.

A4.text: Its function is to ensure fertilization of the ovule and development of fruit containing seeds.

A5.text: Apomixis, setting seed without fertilization, is found naturally in about 2.2% of angiosperm genera.
